<p class="abc"><span class="yo">Alternative performance measures (APMs)</span></p>
<p class="aaz"><span class="yf">Introduction</span></p>
<p class="zh"><span class="yf">In the reporting of financial information, the directors have adopted various APMs. These measures are not defined by International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and therefore may not be directly comparable with other companies APMs, including those in the Group's industry. </span></p>
<p class="zh"><span class="yf">APMs should be considered in addition to, and are not intended to be a substitute for, or superior to, IFRS measurements.</span></p>
<p class="aaz"><span class="yf">Purpose</span></p>
<p class="zh"><span class="yf">The directors believe that these APMs assist in providing additional useful information on the underlying trends, performance and position of the Group.</span></p>
<p class="zh"><span class="yf">APMs are also used to enhance the comparability of information between reporting periods and geographical units (such as like-for-like sales), by adjusting for non-recurring or uncontrollable factors which affect IFRS measures, to aid users in understanding the Group's performance. Consequently, APMs are used by the directors and management for performance analysis, planning, reporting and incentive-setting purposes.</span></p>
<p class="zh"><span class="yf">The directors believe the following metrics to be the APMs used by the Group to help evaluate growth trends, establish budgets and assess operational performance and efficiencies. These measures provide an enhanced understanding of the Group's results and related trends, therefore increasing transparency and clarity into the core results of the business.</span></p>
<p class="zh"><span class="yf">The following metrics are useful in evaluating the Group's operating performance:</span></p>
<div class="story-table-container"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="abd" style="width:661">
<thead>
<tr class="nn">
<td class="ns" style="width:15%">
<p class="abc"><span class="tu">APM</span></p>
</td>
<td class="nr" style="width:13%">
<p class="abc"><span class="tu">Closest equivalent IFRS measure</span></p>
</td>
<td class="nq" style="width:19%">
<p class="abc"><span class="tu">Adjustment to reconcile to IFRS measure</span></p>
</td>
<td class="no" style="width:50%">
<p class="abe"><span class="tu">Definition and purpose</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr class="ne">
<td class="nm" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Underlying Revenue</span></p>
</td>
<td class="nl" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Revenue</span></p>
</td>
<td class="ni" style="width:19%">
<p class="abf"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Exceptional Item</span></p>
</td>
<td class="nf" style="width:50%">
<p class="abg"><span class="nh">The Group defines underlying revenue as revenue for the period adjusted for exceptional items. </span></p>
<p class="abg"><span class="nh">The Directors view underlying revenue to be a meaningful measure to analyse the Group's revenue, excluding exception items. </span></p>
<p class="abg"><span class="nh">Exceptional items are additional specific items that because of their size, nature or incidence in the results, are considered to hinder comparison of the Group's performance on a period to period basis and could distort the understanding of our performance for the period and the comparability between periods and hence are adjusted to arrive at underlying revenue.</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ne">
<td class="nm" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Underlying EBITDA and margin</span></p>
</td>
<td class="nl" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Operating profit </span></p>
</td>
<td class="ni" style="width:19%">
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Depreciation and amortisation </span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Charity and donation </span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Exceptional items</span></p>
</td>
<td class="nf" style="width:50%">
<p class="abg"><span class="nh">The</span><span class="nb"> </span><span class="na">Group</span><span class="mz"> </span><span class="my">defines</span><span class="mx"> </span><span class="nh">underlying</span><span class="mw"> </span><span class="nh">EBITDA</span><span class="nb"> </span><span class="na">as</span><span class="mz"> </span><span class="my">operating profit/(loss)</span><span class="mz"> </span><span class="my">for</span><span class="mx"> </span><span class="nh">the</span><span class="mw"> </span><span class="nh">period</span><span class="nb"> </span><span class="na">before depreciation and amortisation, charity and donation and adjusted for exceptional items. </span></p>
<p class="abg"><span class="nh">The Group defines underlying EBITDA margin as underlying EBITDA divided by underlying revenue.</span></p>
<p class="abi"><span class="nh">Underlying EBITDA and margin are measures used by the directors to assess the trading performance of the business</span><span class="mv"> </span><span class="nh">and</span><span class="mu"> </span><span class="nh">are</span><span class="mt"> </span><span class="na">therefore</span><span class="ms"> </span><span class="mr">the</span><span class="mv"> </span><span class="nh">measure</span><span class="mu"> </span><span class="nh">of</span><span class="mt"> </span><span class="na">segment</span><span class="ms"> </span><span class="mr">profit</span><span class="mv"> </span><span class="nh">that</span><span class="mu"> </span><span class="nh">the</span><span class="mt"> </span><span class="na">Group</span><span class="mq"> </span><span class="my">presents</span><span class="mv"> </span><span class="nh">under</span><span class="mu"> </span><span class="nh">IFRS.</span><span class="mt"> </span><span class="na">Underlying EBITDA and margin are also presented on a consolidated basis because the directors believe it is important to consider</span><span class="mp"> </span><span class="nh">profitability</span><span class="mp"> </span><span class="nh">on</span><span class="mo"> </span><span class="na">a</span><span class="mn"> </span><span class="my">basis</span><span class="mm"> </span><span class="nh">consistent</span><span class="mp"> </span><span class="nh">with</span><span class="mo"> </span><span class="na">that</span><span class="mn"> </span><span class="my">of</span><span class="mm"> </span><span class="nh">the</span><span class="mp"> </span><span class="nh">Group's</span><span class="mp"> </span><span class="nh">operating</span><span class="mp"> </span><span class="nh">segments.</span><span class="mp"> </span><span class="nh">When</span><span class="mo"> </span><span class="na">presented on a consolidated basis, underlying EBITDA and margin are APMs.</span><span class="nh"> </span></p>
<p class="abg"><span class="nh">Depreciation and amortisation is a non-cash item which fluctuates depending on the timing of capital investment and useful economic life. Directors believe that a measure which removes this volatility improves comparability of the Group's results period on period and hence is adjusted to arrive at underlying EBITDA and margin.</span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">Charity and donations are not related to the trading performance of the Group and hence adjusted to arrive at underlying EBITDA and margin. </span></p>
<p class="abg"><span class="nh">Exceptional items are additional specific items that because of their size, nature or incidence in the results, are considered to hinder comparison</span><span class="mk"> </span><span class="na">of</span><span class="mj"> </span><span class="my">the</span><span class="mi"> </span><span class="nh">Group's</span><span class="mh"> </span><span class="nh">performance</span><span class="mh"> </span><span class="nh">on</span><span class="mk"> </span><span class="na">a</span><span class="mj"> </span><span class="my">period-to-period</span><span class="mg"> </span><span class="nh">basis</span><span class="mh"> and </span><span class="nh">could distort the understanding of our performance for the period and the comparability between periods and hence are adjusted to arrive at underlying EBITDA and margin.</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ly">
<td class="mf" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Underlying profit / (loss) before tax</span></p>
</td>
<td class="me" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Profit / (loss) before tax</span></p>
</td>
<td class="md" style="width:19%">
<p class="abf"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Exceptional items</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lz" style="width:50%">
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">The Group defines underlying profit/(loss) before tax as profit/(loss) before tax adjusted for exceptional items. </span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">The directors view underlying profit/(loss) before tax to be a meaningful measure to analyse the Group's profitability.</span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">Exceptional items are additional specific items that because of their size, nature or incidence in the results, are considered to hinder comparison</span><span class="mc"> </span><span class="op">of</span><span class="mc"> </span><span class="tu">the</span><span class="mb"> </span><span class="tu">Group's</span><span class="mc"> </span><span class="op">performance</span><span class="mc"> </span><span class="tu">on</span><span class="mb"> </span><span class="tu">a</span><span class="ma"> </span><span class="tu">period-to-period</span><span class="mc"> </span><span class="op">basis</span><span class="mc"> and </span><span class="tu">could distort the understanding of our performance for the period and the comparability between periods and hence are adjusted to arrive at underlying profit/(loss) before tax. </span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ls">
<td class="lx" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Effective tax rate</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lw" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Reported tax rate</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lu" style="width:19%">
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="xd">Exceptional items</span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="lv">·   </span><span class="uj">Foreign exchange rate movements</span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="xd">One-off tax impact of prior period, tax litigation settlement and impact of tax on permanent differences</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lt" style="width:50%">
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">The Group defines effective tax rate as reported tax rate (reported tax charge divided by reported profit before tax) adjusted for exceptional items, foreign exchange rate movements and one-off tax items of prior period adjustment, tax settlements and impact of permanent differences on tax. </span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">This provides an indication of the current on-going tax rate across the Group. </span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">Exceptional items are additional specific items that because of their size, nature or incidence in the results, are considered to hinder comparison of the Group's performance on a period-to-period basis and could distort the understanding of our performance for the period and the comparability between periods and hence are adjusted to arrive at effective tax rate.</span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">Foreign exchange rate movements are specific items that are non-tax deductible in a few of the entities which are loss making and where DTA is not yet triggered and hence are considered to hinder comparison of the Group's effective tax rate on a period-to-period basis and therefore excluded to arrive at effective tax rate.</span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">One-off tax impact on account of prior period adjustment, any tax litigation settlement and tax impact on permanent differences are additional specific items that because of their size and frequency in the results, are considered to hinder comparison of the Group's effective tax rate on a period-to-period basis.</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="lm">
<td class="lr" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Underlying profit/(loss) after tax</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lq" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Profit/(loss) for the period</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lp" style="width:19%">
<p class="abf"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Exceptional items</span></p>
</td>
<td class="ln" style="width:50%">
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The Group defines underlying profit/(loss) after tax as profit/(loss) for the period adjusted for exceptional items.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The directors view underlying profit/(loss) after tax to be a meaningful measure to analyse the Group's profitability.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">Exceptional items are additional specific items that because of their size, nature or incidence in the results, are considered to hinder comparison of the Group's performance on a period-to-period basis and could distort the understanding of our performance for the period and the comparability between periods and hence are adjusted to arrive at underlying profit/(loss) after tax.</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="lh">
<td class="ll" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Earnings per share before exceptional items</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lk" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">EPS</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lj" style="width:19%">
<p class="abf"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Exceptional items</span></p>
</td>
<td class="li" style="width:50%">
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The Group defines earnings per share before exceptional items as profit/(loss) for the period before exceptional items attributable to owners of the company divided by the weighted average number of ordinary shares in issue during the financial period.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">This measure reflects the earnings per share before exceptional items for each share unit of the company.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">Exceptional items are additional specific items that because of their size, nature or incidence in the results, are considered to hinder comparison of the Group's performance on a period-to-period basis and could distort the understanding of our performance for the period and the comparability between periods and hence are adjusted to arrive at earnings for the purpose of earnings per share before exceptional items.</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="lb">
<td class="lg" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Operating free cash flow</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lf" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Cash generated from operating activities</span></p>
</td>
<td class="le" style="width:19%">
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Income tax paid</span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Changes in working capital</span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Other non-cash items</span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Non-operating income</span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Charity and donation </span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Exceptional items </span></p>
<p class="abh"><span class="nd">·   </span><span class="tu">Capital expenditures</span></p>
</td>
<td class="lc" style="width:50%">
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The Group defines operating free cash flow as net cash generated from operating activities before income tax paid, changes in working capital, other non-cash items, non-operating income, charity and donation and exceptional items, less capital expenditures<span class="ld">.</span> The Group views operating free cash flow as a key liquidity measure, as it indicates the cash available to pay dividends, repay debt or make further investments in the Group. </span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kv">
<td class="la" style="width:15%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">Net debt and leverage ratio</span></p>
</td>
<td class="kz" style="width:13%">
<p class="a"><span class="tu">No direct equivalent</span></p>
</td>
<td class="kx" style="width:19%">
<p class="abk"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Borrowing </span></p>
<p class="abk"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Lease liabilities </span></p>
<p class="abk"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Cash and cash equivalent </span></p>
<p class="abk"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Term deposits with banks</span></p>
<p class="abk"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Deposits given against borrowings/ non-derivative financial instruments</span></p>
<p class="abk"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Fair value hedges</span></p>
</td>
<td class="kw" style="width:50%">
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The Group defines net debt as borrowings including lease liabilities less cash and cash equivalents, term deposits with banks, deposits given against borrowings/non-derivative financial instruments, processing costs related to borrowings and fair value hedge adjustments. </span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The Group defines leverage ratio as net debt divided by underlying EBITDA. </span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="tu">The directors view net debt and the leverage ratio to be meaningful measures to monitor the Group's ability to cover its debt through its earnings.  </span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kq">
<td class="ku" style="width:15%">
<p class="yy"><span class="tu">Return on capital employed</span></p>
</td>
<td class="kt" style="width:13%">
<p class="yy"><span class="tu">No direct equivalent</span></p>
</td>
<td class="ks" style="width:19%">
<p class="abk"><span class="nk">·   </span><span class="op">Exceptional items to arrive at underlying EBIT</span></p>
</td>
<td class="kr" style="width:50%">
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The Group defines return on capital employed ('ROCE') as underlying EBIT divided by average capital employed.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The directors view ROCE as a financial ratio that measures the Group's profitability and the efficiency with which its capital is being utilised.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">The Group defines underlying EBIT as operating profit/(loss) for the period adjusted for exceptional items.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">Exceptional items are additional specific items that because of their size, nature or incidence in the results, are considered to hinder comparison of the Group's performance on a period-to-period basis and could distort the understanding of our performance for the period and the comparability between periods and hence are adjusted to arrive at Underlying EBIT.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">Capital employed is defined as sum of equity attributable to owners of the company, non-controlling interests and net debt. Average capital employed is average of capital employed at the closing and beginning of the relevant period.</span></p>
<p class="abj"><span class="tu">For quarterly computations, ROCE is calculated by dividing underlying EBIT for the preceding 12 months by the average capital employed (being the average of the capital employed averages for the preceding four quarters).</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p class="abl"><span class="ym"> </span></p>
<p class="abl"><span class="ym">Some of the Group's IFRS measures and APMs are translated at constant currency exchange rates to measure the organic performance of the Group. In determining the percentage change in constant currency terms, both current and previous financial reporting period's results have been converted using exchange rates prevailing as on 31 March 2021. Reported currency percentage change is derived on the basis of the average actual periodic exchange rates for that financial period. Variances between constant currency and reported currency percentages are due to exchange rate movements between the previous financial reporting period and the current period.</span></p>
<p class="abl"> </p>
<p class="zi"><span class="km">Changes to APMs</span></p>
<p class="abl"><span class="ym">Definition of underlying EBITDA margin has been clarified as underlying EBITDA divided by underlying revenue. Underlying revenue is included in the APM and is defined as revenue for the period adjusted for exceptional items. The reason for using underlying revenue is because exceptional revenue was recorded in the nine-month period ended 31 December 2020.</span></p>
<p class="zl"><span class="yf"> </span></p>
<p class="zi"><span class="vy">Glossary</span></p>
<p class="zn"><span class="kl">Technical and Industry Terms</span></p>
<div class="story-table-container"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="abm">
<tbody>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kj">
<p class="abn">4G data customer</p>
</td>
<td class="kj">
<p class="abo">A customer having a 4G handset and who has used at least 1 MB on any of the Group's GPRS, 3G & 4G network in the last 30 days.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Airtel Money (mobile money)</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Airtel Money is the brand name for Airtel Africa's mobile money products and services. The term is used interchangeably with 'mobile money' when referring to our mobile money business, finance, operations and activities.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Airtel Money ARPU<br/>
 </p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Mobile money average revenue per user. This is derived by dividing total mobile money revenue during the relevant period by the average number of active mobile money customers and dividing the result by the number of months in the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Airtel Money customer base</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Total number of active subscribers who have enacted any mobile money usage event in last 30 days.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Airtel Money customer penetration</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">The proportion of total Airtel Africa active mobile customers who use mobile money services. Calculated by dividing the mobile money customer base by the Group's total customer base.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Airtel Money transaction value</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Any financial transaction performed on Airtel Africa's mobile money platform.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Airtel Money transaction value per customer per month</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Calculated by dividing the total mobile money transaction value on the Group's mobile money platform during the relevant period by the average number of active mobile money customers and dividing the result by the number of months in the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">ARPU</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Average revenue per user per month. This is derived by dividing total revenue during the relevant period by the average number of customers during the period and dividing the result by the number of months in the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Average customers</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">The average number of active customers for a period. Derived from the monthly averages during the relevant period. Monthly averages are calculated using the number of active customers at the beginning and the end of each month.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Broadband base stations</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Base stations that carry either 3G and/or 4G capability across all technologies and spectrum bands.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Capital expenditure</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). Defined as investment in gross fixed assets (both tangible and intangible but excluding spectrum and licences) plus capital work in progress (CWIP), excluding provisions on CWIP for the period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Constant currency</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">The Group has presented certain financial information that is calculated by translating the results for the current financial year and previous financial years at a fixed 'constant currency' exchange rate, which is done to measure the organic performance of the Group. Growth rates for reporting regions and service segments are in constant currency as it better represents the underlying performance of the business. Constant currency growth rates for prior periods are calculated using closing exchange rates as at the end of prior period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Churn</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Churn is derived by dividing the total number of customer disconnections during the relevant period by the average number of customers and dividing the result by the number of months in the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Customer</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Defined as a unique active subscriber with a unique mobile telephone number who has used any of Airtel's services in the last 30 days.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Customer base</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">The total number of active subscribers that have used any of our services (voice calls, SMS, data usage or mobile money transaction) in the last 30 days.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Data ARPU</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Data ARPU is derived by dividing total data revenue during the relevant period by the average number of data customers and dividing the result by the number of months in the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Data customer base</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">The total number of subscribers who have consumed at least 1 MB on the Group's GPRS, 3G or 4G network in the last 30 days.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Data customer penetration</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">The proportion of customers using data services. Calculated by dividing the data customer base by the total customer base.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Data usage per customer</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Calculated by dividing the total MBs consumed on the Group's network during the relevant period by the average data customer base over the same period and dividing the result by the number of months in the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Diluted earnings per share</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Diluted EPS is calculated by adjusting the profit for the year attributable to the shareholders and the weighted average number of shares considered for deriving basic EPS, for the effects of all the shares that could have been issued upon conversion of all dilutive potential shares. The dilutive potential shares are adjusted for the proceeds receivable had the shares actually been issued at fair value. Further, the dilutive potential shares are deemed converted as at beginning of the period, unless issued at a later date during the period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Earnings per share (EPS)</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">EPS is calculated by dividing the profit for the period attributable to the owners of the company by the weighted average number of ordinary shares outstanding during the period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abp">Foreign exchange rate movements for non-DTA operating companies</p>
<p class="abn">and holding companies</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Foreign exchange rate movements are specific items that are non-tax deductible in a few of our operating entities, hence these hinder a like-for-like comparison of the Group's effective tax rate on a period-to-period basis and are therefore excluded when calculating the effective tax rate.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Free cash flow</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Free cash flow is defined as operating free cash flow less cash interest, income tax paid and change in operating working capital.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kf">
<p class="abn">Information and communication technologies (ICT)</p>
</td>
<td class="kf">
<p class="abo">ICT refers to all communication technologies, including the internet, wireless networks, cell phones, computers, software, middleware, videoconferencing, social networking, and other media applications and services.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Interconnect user charges (IUC)</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Interconnect user charges are the charges paid to the telecom operator on whose network a call is terminated.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Lease liability</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Lease liability represents the present value of future lease payment obligations.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Leverage</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). Leverage (or leverage ratio) is calculated by dividing net debt at the end of the relevant period by the underlying EBITDA for the preceding 12 months.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Minutes of usage</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Minutes of usage refer to the duration in minutes for which customers use the Group's network for making and receiving voice calls. It is typically expressed over a period of one month. It includes all incoming and outgoing call minutes, including roaming calls.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Mobile services</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Mobile services are our core telecom services, mainly voice and data services, but also including revenue from tower operation services provided by the Group and excluding mobile money services.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Net debt</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). The Group defines net debt as borrowings including lease liabilities less cash and cash equivalents, term deposits with banks, processing costs related to borrowings and fair value hedge adjustments.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abp">Net debt to underlying EBITDA (LTM)</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP) Calculated by dividing net debt as at the end of the relevant period by underlying EBITDA for the preceding 12 months (from the end of the relevant period). This is also referred to as the leverage ratio.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Network towers or 'sites'</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Physical network infrastructure comprising a base transmission system (BTS) which holds the radio transceivers (TRXs) that define a cell and coordinates the radio link protocols with the mobile device. It includes all ground-based, roof top and in-building solutions.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Operating company (OpCo)</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Operating company (or OpCo) is a defined corporate business unit, providing telecoms services and mobile money services in the Group's footprint.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Operating free cash flow</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). Calculated by subtracting capital expenditure from underlying EBITDA.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Operating leverage</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). Operating leverage is a measure of the operating efficiency of the business. It is calculated by dividing operating expenditure (excluding regulatory charges) by total revenue.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Operating profit</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Operating profit is a GAAP measure of profitability. Calculated as revenue less operating expenditure (including depreciation and amortisation and operating exceptional items).</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Other revenue</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Other revenue includes revenues from messaging, value added services (VAS), enterprise, site sharing and handset sale revenue.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Reported currency</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Our reported currency is US dollars. Accordingly, actual periodic exchange rates are used to translate the local currency financial statements of OpCos into US dollars. Under reported currency the assets and liabilities are translated into US dollars at the exchange rates prevailing at the reporting date whereas the statements of profit and loss are translated into US dollars at monthly average exchange rates.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Smartphone</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">A smartphone is defined as a mobile phone with an interactive touch screen that allows the user to access the internet and additional data applications, providing additional functionality to that of a basic feature phone which is used only for making voice calls and sending and receiving text messages.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Smartphone penetration</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Calculated by dividing the number of smartphone devices in use by the total number of customers.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Total MBs on network</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Total MBs consumed (uploaded & downloaded) by customers on the Group's GPRS, 3G and 4G network during the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Underlying EBIT</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Defined as operating profit/(loss) for the period adjusted for exceptional items.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Underlying EBITDA</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). Defined as operating profit before depreciation, amortisation, CSR cost and exceptional items.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Underlying EBITDA margin</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). Calculated by dividing underlying EBITDA for the relevant period by revenue for the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Underlying Revenue</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">An alternative performance measure (non-GAAP). Defined as revenue before exceptional items.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn"><span class="ke">Unstructured Supplementary Service Data</span></p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo"><span class="ke">Unstructured Supplementary Service Data (USSD), also known as "quick codes" or "feature codes", is a communications protocol for GSM mobile operators, similar to SMS messaging. It has a variety of uses such as WAP browsing, prepaid callback services, mobile-money services, location-based content services, menu-based information services, and for configuring phones on the network.</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kg">
<p class="abn">Voice minutes of usage per customer per month</p>
</td>
<td class="kg">
<p class="abo">Calculated by dividing the total number of voice minutes of usage on the Group's network during the relevant period by the average number of customers and dividing the result by the number of months in the relevant period.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="kh">
<td class="kd">
<p class="abn">Weighted average number of shares</p>
</td>
<td class="kd">
<p class="abo">The weighted average number of shares is calculated by multiplying the number of outstanding shares by the portion of the reporting period those shares covered, doing this for each portion and then summing the total.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
